bestBHT.bht: The seeds that fell on good ground yielded fruit—a hundredfold, an extraordinary level of increase. This hundredfold harvest is not an exaggeration, as documented in examples from Greece, Italy, and Africa. It represents the only kind of fruit that is truly worth it, showcasing the diverse degrees of fruitfulness in believers' lives. Some have reached greater maturity while others are still growing. The good ground symbolizes hearts that are softened, deeply rooted, and purged of distractions, making them receptive to God's Word.

Henry Alford: 8.] After fruit Mark inserts “that sprang up and increased.” Luke gives only “as hundredfold.”
Marvin Vincent: A hundred-fold. Mentioned as something extraordinary.
Herodotus (i. 93) says of Babylonia, 'In grain it is so fruitful as to yield commonly two-hundred-fold; and when the production is the greatest, even three-hundred-fold.'
Archibald T. Robertson: Yielded fruit (εδιδου καρπον). Change to imperfect tense of διδωμ, to give, for it was continuous fruit-bearing.
Some a hundredfold (ο μεν εκατον). Variety, but fruit. This is the only kind that is worth while.
The hundredfold is not an exaggeration (cf. Genesis 26:12). Such instances are given by Wetstein for Greece, Italy, and Africa.
John Gill: Not beaten and trodden by the feet of men, nor stony, nor thorny, but well broke up, manured, and tilled; which designs good, honest-hearted hearers who become so by the Spirit and grace of God.
Some seeds produced an hundred, others sixty, and others thirty. The first of these especially was a large increase...of such fruitfulness was the land of Israel.

Here, in the parable, these various increases intend the different degrees of fruitfulness in gracious souls...Some believers are grown to a greater maturity than others; some are but little children, some are young men, some are fathers.
John Wesley: Good ground — Soft, not like that by the highway side; deep, not like the stony ground; purged, not full of thorns.

bhtAttempts.bht: In Matthew 13:8, Jesus speaks of the seeds that fell on good ground and yielded fruit - some a hundredfold. The mention of a hundredfold is remarkable and not an exaggeration, as seen in examples from Greece, Italy, and Africa. The hundredfold represents the only kind of fruit that is truly worth it. This abundant increase, like that of the fruitful land of Israel, signifies the different degrees of fruitfulness in believers' lives. Some believers have reached greater maturity, while others are still growing. The good ground represents the hearts of those who have been softened, deeply rooted, and purged of any distractions.

In this passage, the seeds that fell on good ground yielded fruit - some a hundredfold, a truly extraordinary harvest. The mention of a hundredfold is not an exaggeration, as seen in examples from Greece, Italy, and Africa. This impressive increase represents the only type of fruit that is truly valuable. It symbolizes the different levels of fruitfulness in the lives of believers, with some reaching greater maturity than others. The good ground represents hearts that are softened, deeply rooted, and free from distractions.

The seeds that fell on fertile ground produced an exceptional harvest - some a hundredfold, a truly remarkable increase. This abundant yield is not an exaggeration, as evidenced by examples from various regions. It signifies the only kind of fruit that holds great value. It represents the diverse levels of fruitfulness in the lives of believers, with some attaining higher maturity than others. The receptive hearts are like well-prepared soil, deeply rooted, and free from distractions.

The seeds that fell on good ground yielded fruit—a hundredfold, an extraordinary level of increase. This hundredfold harvest is not an exaggeration, as documented in examples from Greece, Italy, and Africa. It represents the only kind of fruit that is truly worth it, showcasing the diverse degrees of fruitfulness in believers' lives. Some have reached greater maturity while others are still growing. The good ground symbolizes hearts that are softened, deeply rooted, and purged of distractions, making them receptive to God's Word.

The fruitful seeds that fell on good ground yielded an extraordinary harvest, a hundredfold increase. This remarkable bounty is not an exaggeration and finds parallels in Greece, Italy, and Africa. It represents the only kind of fruit that holds true value, showcasing the varied levels of fruitfulness among believers. Some have attained higher maturity while others are in the process of growth. The good ground symbolizes hearts that are soft, deeply rooted, and free from distractions, making them receptive and fertile for God's Word.
